channel.title: [SOLVED] Can I backup my workstation data?
channel.description:
I recently stumbled into a problem with my workstation and unless I can fix that, I'll have to completely reinstall Whonix altogether. Here's a link to the thread with my original problem: https://forums.whonix.org/t/i-cant-get-into-my-workstation/4478/3
I cant get into the actual workstation, but I can get into the virtual console. Since I can access the konsole, can I backup my files from there and somehow recover it in the newly installed workstation? If so, how?
Thanks!

item.title: [SOLVED] Can I backup my workstation data?

item.description:

item.title: [SOLVED] Can I backup my workstation data?
item.dc:creator: GuyInTheSky
item.description:
I recently stumbled into a problem with my workstation and unless I can fix that, I’ll have to completely reinstall Whonix altogether. Here’s a link to the thread with my original problem:

[SOLVED] I can't get into my workstation! Support
Hey, thanks for the response. Unfortunately when I tried reinstalling vlc like you suggested, it did work. It said it was already at its newest version. https://imgur.com/a/kTIkv I mean look at all the packages that it says are no longer required! Even I can tell by looking at that something is wrong. Is there another way to get lost packages back? Or a way to re-install all of whonix’s dependencies? Is it possible to get out of the virtual terminal and boot the workstation normally? Thanks …

I cant get into the actual workstation, but I can get into the virtual console. Since I can access the konsole, can I backup my files from there and somehow recover it in the newly installed workstation? If so, how?

Thanks!

Read full topic
item.source: [SOLVED] Can I backup my workstation data?
